intro: Plagiobothrys tenellus f. minimus, commonly known as the small-flowered palmer's bladderpod, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue to purple flowers and narrow, hairy leaves. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in arid or semi-arid environments. It is a herbaceous perennial that produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in some regions.
